name: Rachel Maddow
Bias Analysis: Political Views: Rachel Maddow is known for her coverage of the Trump/Russiagate story. According to a New York Times article, She has been labeled conspiratorial” (by Slate), a partisan hack” (by Glenn Greenwald, a former friend), the queen of collusion” (by The Washington Post), and much smarter than this” (by The Guardian).” In an Advocate interview in 2010, she described herself as I’m undoubtedly a liberal.” Finally, during the presidency of Republican Donald Trump, Maddow would report negatively on him nightly. She has also been called a Democratic candidate King Maker through her influence.”
Scientific Views: She generally holds pro-science views such as advocating for climate change action, reports realistically on Covid-19.
Social Views: She considers herself Catholic and is Pro-LGBTQ rights. She also supports Black Lives Matter and generally promotes social justice, equity, and fair immigration.

name: Andrea Mitchell
Bias Analysis: Political Views: Andrea Mitchell is a registered Democrat. She has criticized figures like Donald Trump for being completely uneducated about any part of the world.” and faced backlash from Florida Governor Ron DeSantis for a question on his education policies. Further, in a Politico article titled Sanders to Andrea Mitchell: ‘Please do not moan to me about Hillary Clinton’s problems,’ Bernie Sanders dismissed Mitchell’s suggestion that his criticisms of Hillary Clinton could benefit Donald Trump, indicating that Mitchell supported the Center-Left candidate Clinton over the Progressive Left candidate, Sanders. Andrea Mitchell’s reporting, which has drawn criticism from conservative figures like Donald Trump and Ron DeSantis, and her interaction with Bernie Sanders, suggest a left-center perspective.

Scientific Views: Andrea Mitchell has shown a commitment to covering scientific topics, especially climate change. For instance, her perspective on the gas tax holiday aligns with those of many climate change advocates. During the Covid-19 pandemic, Mitchell frequently reported from a pro-science perspective focusing on facts.

Social Views: Andrea Mitchell has reported extensively on social issues, including women’s rights, racial justice, and LGBTQ+ rights. She has interviewed numerous activists and experts on these topics, and her reporting often reflects a progressive perspective on social issues.

name: Piers Morgan
Bias Analysis: Political Views: Piers Morgan has been vocal about his support for certain conservative policies, especially regarding crime and immigration. He has also criticized companies for being Woke” and is opposed to Cancel Culture.” However, he has also shown liberal stances on issues like gun control, especially during his time at CNN.

Scientific Views: In a vaccine safety debate with RFK Jr., who is known for his anti-vaccine views, Piers Morgan was supportive of the COVID-19 vaccines. He emphasizes their safety, the rigorous scientific process behind their development, and the importance of relying on credible scientific sources for information. Further, in an interview, he stated, Climate change and global warming are real.”

Social Views: In a debate on Good Morning Britain,” Piers Morgan expressed skepticism about the introduction of over 100 gender identities, emphasizing the binary concept of male and female while acknowledging respect for transgender individuals. However, the organization GLAAD claims he has a record of transphobic comments. Finally, he has been accused of racial prejudice on his show.

name: Jeanine Pirro
Bias Analysis: Political Views: Jeanine Pirro strongly backs former President Donald Trump. For example, she attends Republican fundraising events and helps raise money for the party. Pirro faced criticism for her anti-Muslim remarks about Rep. Omar in 2019, and Trump defended her and called for her return to the airwaves despite network condemnation. Furthermore, Axios reported that in the final 30 minutes of his presidency, Trump granted a pardon to Albert J. Pirro, the ex-husband of Jeanine Pirro, a lawyer, real estate developer, and Republican fundraiser. Al Pirro had been imprisoned for tax offenses. In February 2021, Smartmatic filed a defamation lawsuit related to the 2020 United States presidential election fraud claims, naming Pirro as one of the defendants. In March 2022, the judge dismissed the claims against her; however, Smartmaric reinstated the lawsuit in February 2023.
Scientific Views: Jeanine Pirro states climate change is a woke agenda about fear democrats want to invoke.

Social Views: Jeanine Pirro aligns with conservative values on social issues and has faced criticism for making racist comments, including her remarks on Will Smith’s incident at the Academy Awards, where she suggested that the Oscars were not the hood.” She has also been accused of promoting anti-Muslim sentiments.

name: Joe Scarborbough
Bias Analysis: Political Views:  Joe Scarborough was initially supportive of former President Trump; however, later reported negatively on him. This resulted in Trump tweeting personal attacks on Scarborough, such as calling him a psycho” and spreading conspiracy theories against him. In 2017, Scarborough announced officially during CBS’ The Late Show with Stephen Colbert that he left the Republican Party and became independent.
Scientific Views: Voted against Climate action in the past, now supports the consensus of science on climate change.
Social Views: Joe Scarborough is Pro-Life. He was critical of the former president’s travel ban on Muslim countries. Further, he criticizes President Biden’s immigration policy.

name: George Stephanopoulos
Bias Analysis: Political Views: George Stephanopoulos was previously an advisor to former Democratic President Bill Clinton. In 2012, 2013, and 2014 it was revealed that he donated $75,000 to the Clinton Foundation. Republicans pointed out this conflict of interest, and he was forced to drop out as a moderator of the scheduled February 2016 Republican presidential primary debate. For the most part, his views align with the moderate Democratic Party.
Scientific Views: Supports the consensus of science on both climate change and Covid-19.
Social Views: He supports the social positions of the Democratic Party.

name: Sean Spicer
Bias Analysis: Political Views: Served as White House Press Secretary and White House Communications Director under Republican President Donald Trump in 2017. According to an NPR article, in his book The Briefing,” Sean Spicer wrote his priorities are: God, family, country, Navy, Republican Party, candidate.” Sean Spicer describes himself on his website as Sean is a lifelong Republican operative and anyone who has worked with him knows him as relentless, quick-witted, and loyal.”

Scientific Views: He generally holds the Republican Party’s view that climate change is of little concern. Reports indicate that Sean Spicer is vaccinated against Covid-19. As Press Secretary, he frequently promoted former President Trump’s conspiracy theories and pseudoscience.

Social Views: He considers himself Catholic. GLAAD describes Sean Spicer as Served as the Republican National Committee’s communications director at a time (2011-2017) when the party stood near united against LGBTQ rights, furthered sweepingly anti-LGBTQ party platforms, and lashed out against court decisions that advanced rights.” Opposes abortion.
